entry.title: Newsletter #78
entry.content:
#TechThursday is here!

Well, we have one more T-shirt clash, as usual (Daniel and Ayham):

Important notice: There is a vulnerability in the namshi/jose library which you should worry about. For more information on that and how to fix it, read http://tech.namshi.io/blog/2015/02/19/update-your-namshi-slash-jose-installations-as-a-security-vulnerability-was-found/

Here is the list with awesome links to keep you busy during the weekend:

  • Design Thinking

  • Spring cleaning of your docker containers

  • What are the characteristics of a bad software engineer?

  • Web Servers in Firefox OS

  • New GitHub Username Shirts in the Shop

  • Route 53 Update – Tagging, CloudTrail, One-Click Alarms, Visible Health Check Status

  • 26 Little-Known Facts About Google

  • Please, go away

  • Preparing Your Node JS Application For Scale

  • Pairing as Pruning

  • Protip: With Chrome Dev Tools

  • A tool for creating GIF screencasts

  • Patterns Enhance Craft: The Final Step, Pareto Effort

  • HTTP/2 is Live in Firefox

  • Winning with HTTP Interceptors in AngularJS

  • Variables and scoping in ECMAScript 6

  • Introducing the Observable

  • Creating defensive objects with ES6 proxies

  • ECMAScript 6: maps and sets

  • PSR-7 HTTP Message Interface has entered the Review stage

  • HTTP/2 is finished, and should be coming to browsers soon

  • asm.js coming to IE

  • Javascript’s console lesser known features.

  • Nine Things to Expect from HTTP/2

  • SOLID podcast by Three Devs and a May be

  • How To Dockerize A Multi-Container App From Scratch

  • Design Better Experiences For Web & Mobile – Invision App

  • Gmail Delay Send sciprt to schedule your emails for free

  • Which Came First? The Chicken or the Egg

  • Link Between Corruption and Wealth

  • top 10 tech of 2015

  • Are You A Serious Analyst

  • The Amazing World of Freds Big Data

  • acquisitions in India for Ecommerce

  • Zalando doing great

entry.title: Newsletter #77
entry.content:
